svg.content: <mxfile userAgent="Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/65.0.3325.181 Safari/537.36" version="8.5.1" editor="www.draw.io" type="google"><diagram id="6133507b-19e7-1e82-6fc7-422aa6c4b21f" name="Page-1"></diagram></mxfile>

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Verdana; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 120px; max-width: 238px; width: 238px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div:
The files belonging to each catalogue. Each entry contains a file's Content Hash, file ID delta and hashed filename.
The lookup3 filename hash is almost exclusively used for either; loading specific files by name or printing names in errors e.g. BLS.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Verdana; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 60px; max-width: 183px; width: 183px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div: Conains the BLTE Compressed Size, the BLTE encoded hash and the Layout String Index.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; height: 203px; overflow: hidden; width: 369px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.p: The Encoding file is a global lookup for the entire storage container. It contains information for all files regardless of locale, flags or OS.

p.span: every file that has been download
is not missing and/or broken using
If any join to the Encoding is broken, the client simply won't load.

div.p: The Encoding file comprises of 6 sections and a header of which the important 4 are... (the remaining 2 are for validating the Encoding file's integrity)

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Verdana; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 80px; max-width: 158px; width: 158px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div: A record of every file documenting the file's decompressed size, BLTE hash, and a list of their Content Hashes.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Verdana; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 70px; max-width: 249px; width: 249px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div: Contains unique strings that describe how this data is stored and should be read e.g. compression, encryption and banded-size. Many files can use the same layout string.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 84px; white-space: nowrap; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Verdana; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 138px; max-width: 266px; width: 266px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div:
Contains "catalogues" of files that a grouped by their Locale and Content flags i.e. <enUS, LowViolence>, <All_WoW, None> etc.
This allows the client to just request the files it needs reducing redundant downloads. This also means that Blizzard can create variants of files for a specific locale and not have to recreate references in the DBs/other files.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Verdana; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 108px; max-width: 306px; width: 306px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div:
A lookup table to tell the client what data archive, the offset and the size of each file in the data archives. This is solely for performance reasons.
If the file hashes don't match the Encoding file the client won't start. Not all files will be in the indices, those that aren't will be downloaded directly from the CDN.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 96px; white-space: nowrap; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Verdana; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 58px; max-width: 266px; width: 266px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div: All files referenced in each CDN index are BLTE encoded and stored into a single blob with the same name as the index, minus the extension.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Verdana; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 48px; max-width: 336px; width: 336px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div: A file containing the current version and Build Config and CDN Config hash for each Region. The client reads this on startup.

switch.text: A file containing the current version and Build Config and CDN Config hash for each Region. The client reads this on startup.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Verdana; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 98px; max-width: 336px; width: 336px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div:
A file containing the names of Blizzard CDN servers for each Region. The client reads this on startup.
The client iterates through each until it finds the file it needs otherwise produces a CAS error (when loading) or a Stream error (in game).

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Verdana; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 78px; max-width: 266px; width: 266px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div: A file containing the hashes and sizes for each of the the current version's named files; Root, Encoding etc. The client reads this on startup and verifies that the local data matches otherwise (re)downloads them.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Verdana; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 98px; max-width: 266px; width: 266px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div:
Contains a list of all available CDN Indices and Patches.The client reads this on startup.
If any of these are missing the client will throw a not found CAS exception (the most common issue with Legion private servers).

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Verdana; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 58px; max-width: 266px; width: 266px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div: A local representation of the CDN indices but pointing to the local data.xxx archives.

switch.text: A local representation of the CDN indices but pointing to the local data.xxx archives.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Verdana; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 38px; max-width: 266px; width: 266px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div: A local representation of the CDN Data Archives. These are combined into blobs of ~1GB.

switch.text: A local representation of the CDN Data Archives. These are combined into blobs of ~1GB.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 84px; white-space: nowrap; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Verdana; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 88px; max-width: 266px; width: 266px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div:
A local representation of the Versions and CDNs but as a single file.
If this matches the local files, the client won't always request the remote variants however it is intermittent at best.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 13px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 371px; white-space: nowrap; word-wrap: normal;
div.div:
Key:
Content Hash - MD5 checksum of the raw file
BLTE Hash - MD5 of the file after BLTE encoding
Yellow Border - Shared files (identical on both local and remote)
Green Border - Local files
Blue Border - Remote files
Red Border - Format/Implementation details
Red Header - Not implemented in CASCHost
Purple Header - B-Net App/Agent specific files

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Verdana; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 98px; max-width: 266px; width: 266px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div:
BLTE is a Blizzard specific file container that consists of a single file split into blocks of data.
Blizzard use this to have the ability to split files into different "blocks". Each block can then have different compression and encryption applied.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Verdana; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 158px; max-width: 223px; width: 223px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div:
Another subset of files, similar in design to the CDN indices/data, that contain patch information. The client will apply incremental patches opposed to re downloading the complete changed file to save bandwidth.
The patch entries themselves are identical to the PTCH files found in Cata+ MPQs.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Verdana; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 158px; max-width: 246px; width: 246px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div:
The download contains a reference to all files in the CAS archive excluding the Encoding file. It is used to prioritise the download order of files.
This utilises the same tag system as the Install file to prevent redundant downloads.
This is only used by the B-Net App and Agent and is not part of the client's DoD system.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Verdana; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 168px; max-width: 246px; width: 246px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div:
The Install file contains a list of files that appear in the player's WoW directory e.g. the executables and dlls.
Each file is assigned a set of tags to ensure the client only requests the ones specific to the OS (akin to the catalogue flags).
This is only used by the B-Net App and Agent and is not part of the client's DoD system.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Verdana; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 50px; max-width: 148px; width: 148px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div: Same as the Layout Strings but for each section of the Encoding file.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 96px; white-space: nowrap; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 84px; white-space: nowrap; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Verdana; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 58px; max-width: 266px; width: 266px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div: This is simply all Local Indices merged into one large index. This isn't required for the client to function.

switch.text: This is simply all Local Indices merged into one large index. This isn't required for the client to function.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Verdana; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 148px; max-width: 581px; width: 576px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div:
1. Read the Versions and CDNs files from the internal strings. If this fails, throw a CAS Error.
2. Download the Encoding file. Validate the Encoding's hash and data.
3. Download the Root file. Validate the Root's hash and data including joins to the Encoding file.
4. Download the CDN indices. Validate the CDN indices join to the Encoding file.
5. Begin downloading the data files as and when requested by the client - interface, shaders etc take priority.
6. Generate the data.xxx and .idx files as data downloads.
7. Continue with 5 but in game. Throw a Stream Error instead if a file is unobtainable.
If any of the above exists locally already and is not malformed, it will be skipped from the download queue.
For all downloading: the client will iterate all CDN servers and attempt retries before throwing a 404 error.
